body: Harlequins, who are preparing for their European Challenge Cup final against Montpellier on Friday, are mourning the death of their England youth player Seb Adeniran-Olule in a road accident. The 20-year-old prop, who had been at the club since he was 13, had just begun breaking into the first team. The club said: “Harlequins is deeply saddened to learn the news of the untimely death of Seb Adeniran-Olule in a road traffic collision.” Conor O’Shea, Harlequins director of rugby, added: “Our thoughts and prayers are with Seb’s family and friends at this difficult time. Seb was an incredible talent and had already represented England at under-age level as well as making his senior debut for Quins at just 20. “He will be sorely missed by the whole squad as well as by the wider club.” Adeniran-Olule, an England Under-20 international, made three first-team appearances for Quins, including in this season’s European Challenge Cup pool game against Italian side Calvisano.
webTitle: Harlequins’ England youth player Seb Adeniran-Olule dies in road accident
